answers.answer: Lots of water! And avoid salt. It could indicate preeclampsia but my midwife said don't worry too much if it's just in your feet. Once it goes to your hands and face she starts to worry. Check your blood pressure if you're worried about it. You should know from your visits what your normal reading is. If you check it and it's much higher than usual, call your doctor asap. Most drug stores have free checks fyi.
Okay thanks!:) I'm going to the dr in the am so I'll get it figured out then! Just alittle scary! Never had swelling with my first born

I had minor swelling. Nothing major until after my daughter was born, and then I couldn't even jam my feet into my husband's shoes! I wrote flip flops home from the hospital two days after thanksgiving lol!
It could be caused by something else.preeclampsia doesnt show up until the third tri. It could be but you wont be able to get tested until the third tri.
Lol I had severe swelling in my feet at the end but I was like 36 weeks and up when that happened it was horrid!! Just didn't think it started this early!
But a lot of women get swelling. Doesn't mean you have preeclampsia :)

question: I've been really light headed and out of breath the last 2 days and my ankles have been super swollen!! I'm going to my family doctor tomorrow but is this a symptom of preclampsia and should I be concerned?I used a lot of bleach cleaning my bathroom the other day and then this started, don't know if that has anything to do with it but it's kinda scaring me because I don't see my ob until April 1st!!Also what could help with the swelling besides putting my feet up?
title: 19 weeks, Ankle swelling.. Preclampsia symptom?
